documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
Privacy PolicyWho are we

Heygo is a virtual travel platform that offers a range of online travel experiences. To provide you with the full range of Heygo products and services, we need to collect and process information about you.

This policy (the Privacy Policy ) is incorporated by reference into our Terms of Service. Any terms defined in the Terms of Service shall have the same meaning in this Privacy Policy unless specified otherwise.

The Privacy Policy and our Cookies Policy apply to all users of our Website and the Services. This includes where you visit or use our online services and we collect your personal information. These include:

  • the Heygo website at www.heygo.com and any webpage, subdomain, subpart and variant of that website. and
  • social media or official Heygo content on other third party websites.

It also relates to our use of any personal information you provide to us in person, by phone, in letters, email and other correspondence.

For the purposes of this Privacy Policy, the data controller is Virtualtrips Limited, registered in England and Wales under company registration number 12623120, with its registered office at 27 Old Gloucester Street, London, WC1N 3AX, United Kingdom.

We value your privacy

Virtualtrips Limited ( Heygo, we, us, our ) is committed to protecting your personal information and being as open with you as possible about the data and information we hold and how we use it.

It is important that you read this Privacy Policy to understand the information we may hold about you, how we use it and how you can access or update your information, modify your preferences or request the deletion of your personal data.

For information regarding the use of cookies on the Heygo Website please read our Cookie Policy.

We may make amendments and updates to this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any updated versions will be made available on this page so you will be able to access the latest version. We ask that you review this page regularly to be kept up to date with any changes.

We use your information in line with all applicable laws and regulations regarding the protection of personal information, including the Data Protection Act 2018, the Privacy and Electronic Communications (EC Directive) Regulations 2003 and 2011 and the General Data Protection Regulations (GDPR), and including any amendments or updates to these and any equivalent or successor applicable laws and regulations.

Information we collect

When you register for an account with us, you may provide us with your personal details, including your email address, name and your chosen password. Once you have registered you can edit your personal details in your account. If you log in with Google, Facebook or another social media account, those sites may give us access to your limited personal details (including your email address and account ID) in order to verify if you are logged in with their site. Once you are logged in to our Website, your use of the Website and your data will be handled in accordance with this Privacy Policy and the Cookie Policy. We are not responsible for any use of your personal data by Google, Facebook or any other social media site.

The information we collect may include:

  • your behavior on our Website, including but not limited to the terms you search for, videos you watch and the messages you send on the Website’s chat function;
  • views and interactions with content and ads, including those shown on third party websites.
  • voice and audio information when you use audio features.
  • purchase activity;
  • the way you access our digital services, including operating system, IP address (which is helpful to save your timezone preferences), online identifier details.
  • social preferences, interests and activities.
  • people with whom you communicate or share content with. and
  • activity on third-party sites and apps that use our services.

If you book, or request to book, a pre-paid tour through the Website, you may provide us with additional personal information, such as your name, email address, gender, city, country, preferred language(s), group size, interests, ages and further details about you or your group members. With your consent, these will be shared with the Host you are requesting to book with.

If you express an interest in partnering with us as a Host, then we may collect additional personal information, such as your city, country, phone number, information about you or your guiding experience and companies worked for, and personal photos you choose to display.

When you make a purchase or tip you will be required to supply payment card details. We use Stripe as a third party payment provider to manage online card payment transactions. Payment card information is collected over a secure online payment gateway provided by Stripe and processed in accordance with their privacy policy, which can be found here.

All payment transactions processed are encrypted. Your payment card information is used solely to process payments for any bookings or tips made. We retain no record of your payment card details.

When you communicate with Heygo we collect information about your communication and any additional information you choose to provide. You may also send us information when you fill in a form, update or add information to your Heygo account, respond to surveys, participate in promotions, communicate with our team, share your experiences with us or use other features of the Website.

How we use the information we collect

We use the information we collect to:

  • provide and administer the Website and related services and manage internal operations, including troubleshooting, data analysis, research, testing, statistical and survey purposes, and to develop the Website and our products and services.
  • develop new services based on the information we collect in existing services.
  • customise our services to you, including providing recommendations, personalised content, ads and search results.
  • provide customers who have agreed to receive marketing communications, with relevant and timely offers by email.
  • provide a user with a friendly online search experience. This includes the use of website analytics tools as described further in our Cookie Policy.
  • identify the location of visitors, to block disruptive or fraudulent use, and to establish the number of visits from different countries. and
  • communicate with you directly. For example, we may send you notifications when you have upcoming tours or new tours are being released.
Basis we use to process your information

We process your data based on the lawful bases set out below. We may process information you provide based on more than one lawful ground depending on the specific purpose for which we are using it:

  • to enter into a contract with you and fulfil our contractual obligations to you. This processing is necessary for us to provide the service you have requested including registering and managing your account and providing service updates and our support services;
  • to provide information and take actions in relation to services which you have consented to receive. This includes where you request for your details to be passed onto a third party (for example, where you are making an enquiry for a small group or private tour) or where you agree to receive relevant marketing communications from us;
  • where processing is necessary to comply with our legal or statutory requirements. and/or
  • to improve our Website, products and/or services, understand how visitors and customers use our Website, the Services, undertake market research and inform our general marketing, to run our business and maintain the security of our Website and the Services for you, us and other Website visitors and customers.

Where you have given consent for Heygo to process your personal data you may withdraw your consent at any time by emailing info@heygo.com. We will stop processing your data based on that consent but this does not affect any processing done at any time before withdrawal.

If you have consented for your details to be passed to a Host or other third party your data may already have been used by them to respond to your request before we can action your consent withdrawal. In this event, you will need to contact them to withdraw your consent to their use of your personal data.

Disclosure of your information

Heygo will not pass on your personal data to third parties except as set out in this Privacy Policy or with your consent. We may disclose your personal information to third parties for the following purpose(s) and in the following circumstances:

  • we will send your personal information to Hosts, tour companies and relevant third parties to enable them to provide you with the Tour Services and related services and experiences that you have requested or consented to receive details of through the Website. In certain circumstances, they may subsequently transfer, process and store your personal information outside of the European Economic Area ( EEA ) for their business and administration purposes, in accordance with their own privacy policies. If you have queries or require more information on how these third parties use information, please read their privacy policies or contact them;
  • we may use service providers to help us run the Website or Services, some of whom may be based outside the EEA. Some of our webpages use embedded videos and plugins from third party platforms (such as from Youtube). If you browse these pages while also logged in to your account on the third party platform, information collected by the third party may be connected to your account on the third party platform. If you have queries or require more information on how these third parties use information, including transfers outside of the EEA, please read their privacy policies or contact them. You can access the Google privacy policy here which is relevant for Youtube’s services;
  • where we are under a duty to disclose or share your personal information to comply with any legal obligation, or to enforce our terms and conditions and any other agreements;
  • if we sell or buy any business or assets, in which case Heygo may disclose your personal data to the prospective seller or buyer of such business or assets;
  • if we, or substantially all of our assets, are acquired by a third party, personal data held by us about our users may be disclosed to the prospective buyer;
  • we may share your personal information with our group companies;
  • we may share non-personally identifiable information publicly and with our partners, like publishers, developers, advertisers or rights holders. For example, we may share information publicly to show trends about the general use of our services. We may also allow specific partners to collect information from your browser or device for advertising and measurement purposes using their own cookies or similar technologies;
  • we may share any information that we collect with third parties, including but not limited to our legal and professional advisors, the police, other public or private sector agencies, governmental or representative bodies in accordance with the relevant legislation for the purposes of the prevention or detection of offences, and/or the apprehension or prosecution of offenders.

We are not responsible for any use of your personal data by the above parties except where they act as our processor.

Protecting your personal data

Heygo will take all reasonable steps to ensure that your data is treated securely and in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

All information you provide to us is stored securely within the EU, and not transferred outside the EEA unless specifically detailed.

Payment card information and details you provide when requesting to book a tour is handled in accordance with the relevant service providers’ privacy policies and may be transferred and stored or processed by them outside of the EEA in accordance with their privacy policies. Where we transfer your data outside of the EEA, we will ensure that safeguards are in place to provide a similar degree of protection. This may include having contractual protections in place with our service providers or transferring your data to countries or parties which are recognised as providing suitable protection by the European Commission.

Certain parties to whom we disclose your personal data may transfer your data outside of the EEA after we disclose it to them as part of their business and administration activities. We are not responsible for any use of your personal data by these parties except where they act as our processor. If you have queries or require more information on how these third parties use your information, including such transfers outside of the EEA, please read their privacy policies or contact them.

Heygo uses procedures and security features designed to prevent any unauthorised access to your data that we hold.

Retention period

Heygo will process personal data for as long as necessary to fulfil the purpose we collected it for, including the purpose of legal, reporting and accounting requirements, and for as long as necessary for the prevention and detection of criminal activity. The period for which we process and store the personal data for varies depending on the use you make of the Website and the products and/or services we offer. When you register an account we will retain your data for as long as your account is active and for a period after your account is closed to enable us to satisfy our legal, reporting and accounting requirements.

In some circumstances you can ask us to delete your data: see “Right to be forgotten” below for further information.

In some circumstances we may anonymise your personal data (so that it can no longer be associated with you) for research or statistical purposes in which case we may use this information indefinitely without further notice to you.

Your rights as a data subject

At any point while we are in possession of or processing your personal data, you, have several rights:

  • you have the right to request a copy of the information that we hold about you. In the event that we refuse your request under rights of access, we will provide you with a reason as to why;
  • you have a right to correct data that we hold about you that is inaccurate or incomplete;
  • in some cases you can ask for the data we hold about you to be erased from our records;
  • where certain conditions apply you have a right to restrict the processing.
  • in some cases you have the right to have the data we hold about you transferred to another organisation.
  • you have the right to object to certain types of processing such as direct marketing or profiling. and
  • you have the right to complain as outlined in “Complaints and contact” below.
Complaints and contact

Please email info@heygo.com if you have any queries regarding your rights. You can exercise your rights as set out above or by emailing info@heygo.com. All of the above requests will be forwarded on should there be a third party involved (as set out in this Privacy Policy) in the processing of your personal data. You also have the right to complain directly with the UK supervisory authority which is the Information Commissioner’s Office.

If you have any questions regarding the use of your personal data please contact us at info@heygo.com.

documents.name: Terms of Service
documents.text:
Terms of service

Thank you for using Heygo!

  1. The Terms of Service
    1. The following sets out the terms of service which govern your use of and access to our Website and Services (as defined below) and constitute a legally binding agreement between you and Virtualtrips Limited (the Terms of Service).
    2. Virtualtrips Limited is registered in England and Wales under company registration number 12623120 and with its registered address at 27 Old Gloucester Street, London, WC1N 3AX, United Kingdom (Virtualtrips Limited).
    3. Virtualtrips Limited (Heygo, we, us, our) is a virtual travel platform that offers a range of online travel experiences to allow you to travel the world from anywhere. We own the website www.heygo.com and any webpage, subdomain, subpart and variant of that website (the Website). We enable certain third parties (Hosts) to publish, offer and run live-streamed and online tours (Tour Services). We also provide related services available through our Website (together with Tour Services collectively referred to as the Services).
    4. The Privacy Policy and Cookies Policy are incorporated by reference into these Terms of Service.
    5. You, your, user refers to any person or legal entity that accesses or uses the Website or the Services. These include users who have registered with an account on the Website.
  2. Access to the Website and prohibited activities
    1. We have the right to suspend, amend or revoke access and use of our Website without notice. We grant you a personal, non-transferable and revocable limited right to access the Website and use the Services.
    2. We have the right to limit access to the Website, or any part of the Website, to a registered user.
    3. By using and accessing the Website you warrant and agree that you will not:
      1. breach or attempt to breach any national or international laws or relevant rule or regulation. This includes when you add Content (defined below) to the Website or while you provide Tour Services if you are a Host.
      2. violate any confidentiality, copyright, trademark or other proprietary interest without the explicit consent of the right holder.
      3. in any manner expose or infect the Website or its users’ devices with any viruses or malware or any other code that interrupts or damages the Website and Services.
      4. otherwise interfere with or damage the Website and related services in any way. This includes, but is not limited to, attempting to overload, crash or spam the Website and its users.
      5. provide false or misleading information.
      6. add Content to the Website that is offensive or otherwise use offensive language and images while using the Website or the Services.
      7. frame, mirror, or otherwise incorporate any part of the Website or the Services into any other website or service without our written consent. For the avoidance of doubt, this includes creating any deep-link.
      8. attempt to reverse engineer, modify or translate any software we use.
      9. download any Content available through the Website or the Services, except as explicitly permitted by us.
      10. use the Website, Services and any Content provided through the Website and Services, for any commercial or competitive purpose, except as specifically allowed in these Terms of Service or our written consent. For the avoidance of doubt this includes collecting or using any personal information provided by users without our written consent.
      11. use the Website to solicit, recruit or contact Hosts for employment or business purposes not affiliated with Heygo without our written consent. and
      12. circumvent any security features, including but not limited to those that prevent unauthorised access to a user’s account or the downloading of Content on the Website or Service.
  3. Our role
    1. We are not a retailer or organiser of travel packages under Directive (EU) 2015/2302.
    2. Hosts are solely responsible for the Tour Services that they provide and users who make a booking enter into a contract directly with the Host. Heygo is not a party to that contract.
    3. We act as the Host’s limited agent solely for the purpose of collecting payment on behalf of the Host. We use a third party payment provider to manage online card payment transactions.
    4. It is free to create an account and list a tour on the Website. We charge a fee when a user makes a tip or pays for a ticket for a tour. The fees vary based on the individual arrangements between Heygo and the Host and are included in the tip given or the price specified for the tour and deducted by us from the amount owed by Heygo to the Host. The fees may include other charges such as, but without limitation, taxes, royalties and processing fees. The fees are intended to cover costs Heygo incurs to make the platform available to Hosts and other users.
    5. We do not control any fees charged by your bank and/or credit card company, including fees for transactions in foreign currencies or from foreign persons. Please be aware that currencies rates fluctuate and we do not warrant or verify any currency rates as being accurate.
    6. If you request a refund or exchange, it will be processed by us so long as the request is made 24 hours in advance of the start of the Tour Service.
  4. Hosts
    1. If you choose to become a Host, you agree that your relationship with Heygo is limited to being a third-party and independent contractor, and not as an employee, partner, joint venture or agent of Heygo for any reason.
    2. You agree that you act exclusively for your own benefit and on your own behalf.
    3. You acknowledge that you have the unrestricted option to engage in other employment or business activities.
    4. You are solely responsible for (i) the Content that you add to our Website and the Content you provide during the Tour Service. (ii) your performance and conduct during the Tour Service. and (iii) the acceptable delivery of the Tour Service with all required equipment.
    5. You are solely responsible for (i) complying with all laws, rules and regulations that apply to your Tour Service. (ii) complying with any legal obligations you have with third parties. and (iii) obtaining any required permit or license prior to the start of the Tour Service.
    6. Should you fail to deliver a Tour Service to an acceptable standard then you will compensate and indemnify Heygo for any losses incurred by us. This does not apply when the failure was due to reasons outside of your reasonable control.
  5. Account registration
    1. To obtain access to certain parts of the Website and certain Services, you will need to register for a free account. You will choose a username and password. You warrant and agree that any information you supply when you register will be complete, accurate and correct. You also agree not to register in the name of someone else or choose a username that we consider to be offensive. Your personal information will be protected in accordance with our Privacy Policy.
    2. You are solely responsible for all activity on your account and you agree to keep your password and login details confidential. You agree to notify us of any breach of security or unauthorised access to your account.
    3. You must be of the legal age of majority for where you live to use the Services. If not, you will be able to do so only with the involvement of a parent or guardian. You may not register for an account or use the Services if you are under the age of 13.
  6. Content
    1. You agree that all material provided through and contained in the Services or otherwise made available on the Website (including but not limited to design, formatting, images, videos, names, text and other content (collectively, Content)) (Site Content) is protected by copyrights, database rights, trade secrets, trademarks, or other intellectual and proprietary rights.
    2. You agree not to sell, modify, license, copy, distribute, publish or post any Site Content on any other website or online environment.
    3. For any Content you provide, contribute or make available in connection with the Website or the Services (Provided Content), you agree to grant to Heygo a worldwide, perpetual, non-exclusive, transferable, sublicensable, royalty-free right and license to use, access, reproduce, adapt, modify, display, transform, distribute, translate, publish and create derivative works based on Provided Content in any media, for the purpose of operating the Website and the Services, including any advertising and promotional services. This does not restrict your right to use Provided Content for purposes outside the scope of the Services.
    4. You agree and warrant that you have the necessary rights and authority to grant the rights and licenses specified in clause 6.3 without violating these Terms of Service. any laws or regulations. or any third party rights.
    5. You agree that any suggestions for modification or change to the Services and any other information or feedback provided to us by you (Suggestions), is the property of Heygo.
    6. Any modification or enhancement developed or made by us relating to the Suggestions (Modifications) is the property of Heygo.
    7. You agree to assign to Heygo any interest or right (including any intellectual or proprietary right such as, but not limited to, copyright, trade secret, trademark or know how) that you may have in any Suggestions or Modifications. At our request you will use your best endeavours to execute any formalities, registrations or documents to give effect to clauses 6.5 to and including 6.7.
  7. Limitation of liability
    1. We are not liable for any (i) interruptions of the internet and associated infrastructure which affects access to the Website and the Services. and (ii) failure to perform any of obligation we have under these Terms of Service due to matters which are beyond our reasonable control.
    2. We may need to perform maintenance on our Website from time to time and cannot guarantee that the Website will always be accessible and available. The Website is provided on an “as-is” and “as-available” basis.
    3. We are not liable if our Website is not available for any period of time, irrespective of the reason.
    4. The Content displayed on our Website or Services is provided without any warranties, conditions or guarantees as to its accuracy. You agree and understand that you may be exposed to Content that is offensive, inaccurate or fraudulent while using the Service and you waive, and agree to waive, any legal or equitable rights or remedies you have against us with respect to such Content.
    5. We do not warrant that the Website is free from viruses or any other damaging or malicious computer programs.
    6. We are not responsible for any loss, damage or disruption to your data or electronic system or device that might happen when you use the Website and Services.
    7. To the extent permitted by law we exclude (i) all warranties, conditions and other terms otherwise implied by law or equity. (ii) any liability for an indirect, consequential or direct loss or damage (including, but not limited to, loss of profits. income. business. data. goodwill. management or office time. and any other loss or damage howsoever arising and whether caused by breach of contract, negligence or another tort, or otherwise, even if it was foreseeable) incurred by any user in connection with our Website or the Services, or any Content or websites linked to by our Website or in the Services.
    8. Nothing in these Terms of Service limits our liability for (i) death. (ii) personal injury caused by our negligence. (iii) fraudulent misrepresentation. or (iv) any liability which cannot be limited or excluded under applicable law.
  8. Indemnification
    1. To the maximum extent permitted by law, you agree to indemnify, release and defend (at our option) Heygo and any of its directors, officers, employees and agents from and against any causes of action, demands, claims, recoveries, damages, liabilities, losses, fines, penalties or other costs or expenses of any kind including, but not limited to, reasonable legal and accounting fees, brought by third parties in connection with your (i) violation of any law, regulation or third party right. (ii) breach of these Terms of Services or documents referenced herein. or (iii) your use of the Website and the Services, including any interactions with other users.
  9. Taxes
    1. If you agree to become a Host, you are solely responsible for understanding and determining your obligations to report, remit, collect or include in the fee you post on the Website any applicable taxes. These taxes may include, but are not limited to, any applicable VAT, indirect sales tax, or corporate or personal income taxes.
    2. Hosts warrant and represent that they will pay such taxes in compliance with the applicable tax law.
    3. We may be required by certain tax law or regulations to collect appropriate tax information from you as a Host. We may also be required to withhold taxes from the payments made to you as a Host and we reserve the right to withhold payments up to the relevant tax amount as required until resolution is reached with the appropriate tax authority.
  10. Term and Termination
    1. We have the right to amend and vary the Terms of Service at any time and it is up to you to check whether any changes have been made. If you use or access the Website after these Terms of Service have been updated, then you will have accepted the changes made.
    2. These Terms of Service will remain in effect until terminated in accordance with this clause.
    3. Without prejudice to clause 2.1 or 10.5, we may terminate the Terms of Service for convenience at any time by giving you 7 days’ notice to your registered email address.
    4. You may terminate the Terms of Service at any time by sending us an email at info@heygo.com. If you are a Host then any confirmed tours will be cancelled and a refund will be issued.
    5. We may terminate the Terms of Service and/or cease providing access to the Website without notice if we believe in good faith that (i) you have violated applicable laws, regulations or third party rights. (ii) you have materially breached your obligations under these Terms of Service. or (iii) it is necessary to protect the property, personal safety or rights of Heygo, its users or third parties.
  11. Links to third party websites
    1. The Website has links to third party websites that are not owned or operated by us. We are not responsible for the content on those websites and the act of linking to those websites does not imply our endorsement of the material contained on those websites or of the controllers or owners.
  12. Governing law
    1. These Terms of Service are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales.
    2. Any dispute which relates to these Terms of Service, or your use of the Website or Services, will be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.
  13. General
    1. We may decide not to exercise or enforce any right available to us under these Terms of Service. Doing so does not waive our rights and we reserve our ability to exercise or enforce that right at a later date.
    2. If any of the provisions in these Terms of Service are found to be invalid, illegal or unenforceable for any reason, then that provision will be replaced by an enforceable and valid provision that matches the intent of the original provision as far as possible, and the remaining provisions will continue to be enforceable and in full effect.
    3. If you do not agree to abide by these Terms of Service then you are required to stop using the Website.
    4. We have the right to assign or subcontract any or all of our rights and obligations under these Terms of Service to a third party. If we choose to use this right, then you will have the option to terminate your account within 7 days. You are not permitted to assign or dispose of any right or obligation under these Terms of Service without our written consent.
    5. Clauses 6 (Content), 7 (Limitation of liability), 8 (Indemnification), 9 (Taxes), 10 (Term and termination), 12 (Governing law), and 13 (General) will survive any termination of the Terms of Service.
  14. Contact
    1. For any questions or assistance you can send us an email at info@heygo.com and we will endeavor to reply as quickly as possible.

documents.name: Cookie Policy
documents.text:
Cookie policy

Virtualtrips Limited respects the privacy of our customers and online visitors. The below details our cookie policy (the Cookie Policy ), which you should read carefully. This Cookie Policy is incorporated by reference into our Terms of Service. Any terms defined in the Terms of Service shall have the same meaning in this Cookie Policy unless specified otherwise.

What are cookies

Cookies are tiny files stored on your computer when you visit websites. We use cookies to remember you when you come back to our site and keep track of the options you have selected.

To get the best Heygo experience, you need to have cookies turned on. If you don't wish to enable cookies, you will still be able to use the Website but you may not be able to use some of the essential features.

Cookies do not harm your computer. We use cookies to perform several functions, including to:

  • help you navigate our Website to provide you with a seamless experience.
  • improve our Website by collecting information on how you use it so that we can provide you with a better experience.
  • personalise features and Content. and
  • enable social media features and deliver targeted advertising.

These cookies are listed out below:

  1. Strictly necessary cookies

    These cookies are required for users to navigate our Website and use its features, which include, accessing your account without having to repeatedly log in. remembering your actions in a session. or making use of billing services.

    Without these cookies, we can not guarantee the performance of our Website

  2. Performance cookies

    We use performance cookies, primarily Google Analytics cookies, to collect information about how users use our website. We collect information such as the part of the webpage clicked, length of time of each session, number of webpages visited, and error messages with the purpose of improving our Website. The analytics cookies used on our site have the following names: _ga, _gat, utma, utmt, utmb, utmc, utmz and utmv. For more information on Google Analytics, please click here.

    If you would like more information about the privacy policy of the Google Analytics’ service, please click here.

    We also use Hotjar in order to better understand our users' needs and to optimize this service and experience. Hotjar is a technology service that helps us better understand our users' experience (eg how much time they spend on which pages, which links they choose to click, what users do and don't like, etc.) and this enables us to build and maintain our service with user feedback. Hotjar uses cookies and other technologies to collect data on our users' behavior and their devices. This includes a device's IP address (processed during your session and stored in a de-identified form), device screen size, device type (unique device identifiers), browser information, geographic location (country only), and the preferred language used to display our website. Hotjar stores this information on our behalf in a pseudonymized user profile. Hotjar is contractually forbidden to sell any of the data collected on our behalf. For further details, please see the 'about Hotjar' section of Hotjar's support site.

  3. Functionality cookies

    Functionality cookies allow us to remember the choices you make on our Website. for example, your username. With this information, we can provide more personalised features to you.

    We use these cookies to verify your account and determine when you’re logged in so we can make it easier for you to access tours and Content. Cookies also help us remember your browser so you do not have to keep logging into Heygo.

  4. Targeting and advertising cookies of third parties

    Third parties may also use cookies, over which we have no control and we shall not be liable in this respect. Please refer to the third party websites for their respective cookie policies. In particular:

    • we use Google Analytics to analyse the use of our Website, as mentioned above. You can access the Google Analytics privacy policy here;
    • to determine your interests, Google will track your behaviour on our site and on other websites across the internet using the DoubleClick cookie. This behaviour tracking allows Google to tailor the advertisements you see on other websites to reflect your interests. You can view, delete or add interest categories associated with your browser here. You can also opt out of the AdSense partner network cookie using those settings or using the Network Advertising Initiative’s multi-cookie opt-out mechanism here. These opt-out mechanisms themselves use cookies, and if you clear the cookies from your browser your opt-out will not be maintained. To ensure that an opt-out is maintained in respect of a particular browser, you may wish to consider using the Google browser plug-in available here;
    • we use Facebook Pixel which tracks the performance of advertising campaigns. You can read more about how they process data here. and
    • social media providers such as Facebook, Instagram and Youtube, which provide services to both our users and us, use cookies that enable the third parties to collect and store information such as user preferences and pages visited for advertising purposes or improvement of services. Please refer to these third party websites for their respective cookie policies. You can find Facebook’s here, Instagram’s here and Google’s here (which applies to Youtube).

    You block cookies by activating the setting on your browser that allows you to refuse the setting of all or some cookies. If you use your browser settings to block all cookies (including essential cookies) you may not be able to access all or parts of our Website.

    Our website also makes use of the Google AdWords service for remarketing purposes but, as already said above, we have no control over these cookies and we shall therefore not be liable in this respect. If you want to prevent these cookies, please disable them here.

How to prevent cookies

If you want to disable one or more cookies used by our Website, you can express your choice through the third parties’ consent forms found at the websites we are providing to you in this Cookie Policy.

You may also prevent cookies by changing your browser settings. If you consent to our use of cookies but later wish to opt out, you may delete the cookies which have been set and change your browser settings to block any further cookies. For more information please visit:

http://www.allaboutcookies.org

https://support.microsoft.com

https://support.mozilla.org

https://support.google.com

https://support.apple.com

The above links provide information on managing settings for major browser providers.

You can install a Google Analytics browser “plug in” to prevent the website sending information about your visit to Google Analytics. For further information please visit: www.google.com/analytics/learn/privacy.

As cookies are intended to enhance or enable the usability and processes of our Website, preventing or deleting cookies may prevent you from using the features on our Website, or cause the Website to perform differently in your browser than the way it was designed.

Changes to the Cookie Policy

The terms of this Cookie Policy will govern the use of cookies and any information collected while it is in place, except third parties’ cookies. To the extent permitted by applicable law, Heygo reserves the right to change this Cookie Policy at any time. We encourage you to check our Website from time to time for updates. Changes to this Cookie Policy are effective at the time they are posted onto our Website.

Contact

Questions, comments and requests regarding this Cookie Policy are welcomed and should be emailed to info@heygo.com.
